column4: i'm having connectivity issues on a windows domain. I can get out to the net fine, and I can ping hostname and nslookup hostname or hostname.domain.local but I cannot ping or access hostname.domain.local...... any clues?
using a linux client with a windows dhcp/dns server?
i'm assuming that domain.local is hosted on your local server. can you dig domain.local?
yeah ubuntu 8.10 client with server 2003 ad, dhcp, dns. I have other ubuntu boxes working fine but this fresh 8.10 install is just not happy/
maybe a firewall killing icmp responses from hostname.domain.local?
no firewall. But if I ping hostname I get response listed as hostname.domain.local
try finding out if your machine (client) has the correct fqdn. using "hostname --fqdn"
no firewall on the client side? what services are you trying to access?

what services are you trying ot access? a samba share?
